J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> Really? I thought AOP is best for weaving the same code into multiple 
> locations without duplicating it. Extending the TestRunner looks to be 
> much simpler, since one only needs to decorate the TestListener to log 
> the start and end times.
> 
> I do think it's very neat, though, to log all that stuff transparently 
> and review it over time.

Yep you are right. I figured there was a way to do it through the 
framework, but I was just throwing out a suggestion.  I expected someone 
with more knowledge on the JUnit framework would give a better solution 
(which you did).

Use the simplest tool that is appropriate for the job :).

-- Chad
